‚úÖ 1. Make Sure You Re-Append Elements Safely

When you do:

section.innerHTML = "";
section.appendChild(item);

you‚Äôre removing elements from the DOM and re-inserting them, which can sometimes break <zero-md> re-rendering, since it‚Äôs a web component that fetches its markdown asynchronously.

‚úÖ Better: Clone the elements instead of moving them, so the originals stay in memory with styles intact:

function showItems(items) {
  section.innerHTML = "";
  items.forEach(item => section.appendChild(item.cloneNode(true)));
}

Then just call:

all.addEventListener("click", () => showItems([...jsClass, ...dsaClass, ...devClass]));
js.addEventListener("click", () => showItems([...jsClass]));
dsa.addEventListener("click", () => showItems([...dsaClass]));
dev.addEventListener("click", () => showItems([...devClass]));

‚úÖ 2. Your Global Markdown Style Logic Is Perfect, Just Tweak Placement

Move the DOMContentLoaded listener for style injection above the filter logic, so that when you clone or re-render elements later, the <template><style> block already exists inside each <zero-md>. Otherwise, newly created <zero-md> elements might appear unstyled until reloaded.

Here‚Äôs the recommended order:

// 1Ô∏è‚É£ Inject global markdown style first
window.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", () => {
  document.querySelectorAll("zero-md").forEach(md => {
    const template = document.createElement("template");
    template.innerHTML = globalMdStyle.trim();
    md.appendChild(template.content.cloneNode(true));
  });
});

// 2Ô∏è‚É£ Then handle filtering
const section = document.querySelector(".section");
const all = document.getElementById("All");
const js = document.getElementById("JavaScript");
const dsa = document.getElementById("DSA");
const dev = document.getElementById("Development");

const jsClass = document.querySelectorAll(".JS");
const dsaClass = document.querySelectorAll(".DSA");
const devClass = document.querySelectorAll(".DEV");

function showItems(items) {
  section.innerHTML = "";
  items.forEach(item => section.appendChild(item.cloneNode(true)));
}

all.addEventListener("click", () => showItems([...jsClass, ...dsaClass, ...devClass]));
js.addEventListener("click", () => showItems([...jsClass]));
dsa.addEventListener("click", () => showItems([...dsaClass]));
dev.addEventListener("click", () => showItems([...devClass]));

‚úÖ 3. (Optional) Re-apply the Markdown Styles After Filtering

If you clone nodes, they‚Äôll already carry your injected <template><style>, but if you create new <zero-md> dynamically in the future, just re-run:

applyZeroMdStyles();

function applyZeroMdStyles() {
  document.querySelectorAll("zero-md").forEach(md => {
    if (!md.querySelector("template")) {
      const template = document.createElement("template");
      template.innerHTML = globalMdStyle.trim();
      md.appendChild(template.content.cloneNode(true));
    }
  });
}

Then after changing the section:

showItems([...someClass]);
applyZeroMdStyles();

üî• TL;DR ‚Äî Best Practices

‚úÖ Inject <template><style> globally once. ‚úÖ Use .cloneNode(true) when switching content. ‚úÖ Optionally call a helper (applyZeroMdStyles()) if you ever create <zero-md> dynamically.
